availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas H. Corbett (Ballard Co, Kentucky, attorney, Comwlth atty 1st Jud Distr 1860-61)

body.p: Blandville, Kentucky, attorney. Hickman County, Kentucky, native. Attended the Kentucky Military Institute. Studied law under Judge Bigger of Blandville. Admitted to the bar in 1852. Married to Rebecca Coil Corbett on December 22, 1853. Father of Jacob Corbett. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky representing Ballard and McCracken counties from 1855 to 1857 and from 1865 to 1875. Commonwealth's attorney for the 1st Judicial District in Ballard County from 1860 to 1861.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard, Blandsville, p. 7.

The Biographical Encyclopædia of Kentucky of the Dead and Living Men of the Nineteenth Century, vol. 1 (Cincinnati: J. M. Armstrong & Company, 1878), 537.
“Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1860,” in 1861 Kentucky Documents, Legislative Document No. 1. (Frankfort, Ky.: Jno. B. Major, State Printer, 1861), 410.
